bwwExcerpt: When it premiered more than 20 years ago, Ken Ludwig's 'Lend Me a Tenor' felt like an uninspired attempt to write the kind of screwball farce that was so popular decades earlier. It seems no less so with its current Broadway revival, but there's no denying that director Stanley Tucci has staged the hell out of it. The play itself might be derivative, mechanical and devoid of real wit, but this production starring Anthony LaPaglia, Tony Shalhoub and Justin Bartha is at times hysterically funny.

The phrase "staged the hell out of it" also suggests a positive experience despite the source material. | Kimi: While the critic criticizes the play itself as derivative and mechanical, they praise the production as hysterically funny and well-staged, offering a qualified recommendation based on strong direction and performances. | Buckets: claude=Mixed, openai=Mixed, gemini=Positive, kimi=Positive
